name: AmpUp
headline: We make EV charging as simple and reliable as LED lights
description: AmpUp provides the simplicity and reliability enabled Tesla experience EV charging solution in private commercial locations where vehicle dwell times are 6 hours and longer; EG, workplaces, MUDs, and fleet depots. Within 2 years, it achieved 8th in ranking in market share in the commercial level 2 charging sector in the US. AmpUp is growing even faster now with their dominant growth channel in the commercial lighting vertical set to take off at the end of 2023 and early 2024.
generated_description:
**AmpUp: Making EV Charging Easy & Accessible**

Founded in 2018 and based in Cupertino, CA, AmpUp has quickly established itself as a prominent player in the electric vehicle (EV) charging sector. Imagine simplifying EV charging to the level of plugging in an LED light bulb—that's the ambition behind AmpUp.

Their mission? To make EV charging as simple and reliable as LED lights. Initially aimed at commercial locations where vehicles typically dwell for over six hours, AmpUp targets workplaces, multifamily units (MUDs), and fleet depots. Within just two years, they shot to the 8th position in market share for commercial level-2 charging in the U.S. Their growth trajectory suggests even more significant gains ahead as they tap into the commercial lighting vertical, expecting a strong push as 2023 wraps up and 2024 dawns. 

AmpUp's platform comprises three core products: the **AmpUp EV Cloud**, which offers real-time charger management and optimization tools; the **AmpUp EV Driver App**, designed for efficiency and ease for EV drivers; and their **Operations & Maintenance (O&M) Service**, aimed at minimizing downtime with proactive maintenance solutions.

Their customer base already includes notable names like Netflix, Under Armour, and Domino's Pizza, illustrating the diverse applications of their technology—from retail to fleet management and urban mobility solutions.

AmpUp is composed of a talented team of 45 employees, supported by Y Combinator and a partnership with nan. Their focus is squarely on sustainability, reflected in their taglines: 'climate,' 'electric vehicles,' and of course, their strong San Francisco Bay Area roots.

If you’re interested in how AmpUp is revolutionizing the EV charging experience, you can explore more at [ampup.io](https://ampup.io).

In short, AmpUp is at the forefront of making EV charging as effortless as flipping a light switch, working tirelessly to ensure electric mobility doesn’t just live in our imaginations, but in our everyday realities.
